attributes.action: Around 28,000 patients died who potentially only could have been cured.  100,000 died from LCP
attributes.additional_details:
In one year around 28,000 patients died though shortage of trained medical staff who potentially could have been cured.

Also 100,000 patients died from being put on the Liverpool Care Pathway, many without consulting the patient or family.

That is 128,000 people killed by deliberately withdrawing water and nourishment, or negligence by not giving required care. These decisions are being  made by  politicians and civil servants who undoubtedly have private medical insurance.

This is happening as the retirement age is being gradually raised to 70, and Doctors deciding if over 70's warrant treatment.

This petition calls for the government to hold a full debate on these practices, and suspend them, unless and until, the public approve them.
